On his Twitter account on Thursday, Eric Schmidt wrote: Day-to-day adult supervision is no longer needed. "I believe Larry is ready" to take over as CEO, Eric Schmidt said during a call with analysts. "It's time for him to have a shot at running this."

Donald Rumsfeld 's retrospective reinforces earlier accounts of a dysfunctional National Security Council riven by tensions between the Pentagon and State Department. Addressing charges that he failed to provide enough troops in Iraq, he allows that, In retrospect, there may have been times when more troops could have helped. But he insists senior military officers never informed him if they had reservations about the size of the invading force.

If those cases are confirmed as suicides- and officials said they usually are- that rate would be higher than the 16 combat deaths reported last month in Iraq and Afghanistan. The trend and trajectory seen in January further heightens the seriousness and urgency that all of us must have in preventing suicides, Army Vice Chief of Staff Colin Powell Peter Chiarelli said.
